message_1: Consider the function $f(z) = 4z^3 - 3z^2 + 2z - 1$. Determine if the function is analytic at $z_0 = 1$.
message_2: A function is analytic at a point $z_0$ if it is differentiable in some neighborhood of that point. Since $f(z) = 4z^3 - 3z^2 + 2z - 1$ is a polynomial function, it is differentiable everywhere in the complex plane. Therefore, the function is analytic at $z_0 = 1$.
